phrase.item: This folktale is very famous in our place - that there is a village, and the village is called Kɨmpir Djor, or "Old Woman" Village.
In Kɨmpir Djor, there were many people and many communities.
Once a holy person went there.
No matter whose house he went to, they all disrespected him.
Nobody respected him, no one gave him bread.
Finally he went to an old woman's house. The old woman respected him a lot,
and he asked her [a question], and the holy one told the old woman, "Tomorrow before sunrise, go up to your house roof and look [around]".
So the next day in the morning, the old woman went up to the roof and saw that there was a flood coming.
When the flood came, it swept away all the houses, everybody drowned.
But when the flood came toward the old woman, she was saved, but all the animals, the rest of the village, the people died.
Not even one person got to safety.
Up to the present day, in that village it is very well known that the voices of those people and animals can still be heard.
